✨Unbound - Tarana Burke✨ 

📚 one sentence summary
Memoir of the #MeToo Founder #TaranaBurke .

✨Favorite Quote✨
„…and I wondered how that body that holds so much pain could also hold so much joy.” Tarana about Maya Angelou

I don’t know what I expected but I didn’t expect THIS. Wow. My heart was shattering into million pieces reading about her experiences and the experiences of the other million girls and women she encountered. She deserves all the recognition and respect for all the work she has done and is still doing to this day.

This book gave me a deeper understanding about the creation of the #MeTooMovement and how it all started and why.
Originally it was meant to empower Black and Brown Girls and to encourage them to share their stories and connect with others who endured the same trauma. 
To this day Black women are at a higher risk of sexual assault, as nearly 1 in 5 BW are survivors of rape (www.nbwji.com) 

The topics are heavy but it needs to be talked about. 
If you enjoy #Memoirs I would highly recommend to put this one on your list. Please make sure to check all the #TriggerWarnings .

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

DESCRIPTION:
Some days are harder than others. It’s not that we don’t want to forget, it’s that our bodies literally don’t let us. Trust me, if I could forget, I would. 
➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖
The last week has been particularly hard, draining. A lot of memories are bogging down my mind, even in my dreams.

The only thing I can do for myself is follow through with the healthy ways I learned to cope.

I’ve been reminding myself that I am now safe and free from the past. 

I’ve been getting to bed early and getting rest. 

This too shall pass….
➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖➖

DESCRIPTION: #metoo #reliance #sharemarket #contracts

Anna tells her story of teen dating violence when, as a freshman, she was “instantly hooked” by a varsity athlete who made her feel great—until he didn’t. Read Anna’s story via our highlights or linktree. 

Looking back on her traumatic experience, Anna @feelinghealingenhanced wants others to recognize the warning signs of teen dating and how to get help. She recommends the @sashclubs “Teen Dating Violence” Power Topic presentation, via our Power Topics highlight or linktree. 

Anna, like many survivors of abuse by male athletes, found it pointless to report because the school ignored victims. If Anna’s school had taken the proper steps to support reporting students, she could have avoided years of trauma. Schools must create a safe environment for all students, take reports compassionately, and act quickly to stop the harassment. 

Check out SASH Club's Additional Activities page to improve the climate at school or visit @ssaisorg.

🎉L’Ambassade de France est ravie de présenter la programmation du réseau culturel et scientifique canadien à l’occasion de la journée internationale des droits des femmes. 
🚨 Des événements à ne pas manquer !

📍Les Consulats généraux de France, d'Allemagne et de Suisse à Vancouver vous invitent au BCIT Tech Collider pour une soirée passionnante le mercredi 6 mars de 17h à 19h avec des chercheurs en STIM et des professionnels de l'industrie. 

📍A Ottawa, ne manquez pas le 8 mars à 18h le vernissage de l’exposition « NOLA Project » dans la galerie de l’Alliance Française d’Ottawa (352 rue MacLaren). 

📍A Toronto, le 8 mars de 18h30 à 20h, à l’Alliance Française de Toronto, participez à l’échange avec Fatou Toufah Jallow, militante féministe et auteure de « The Woman who inspired an African #MeToo movement”.

📍L’Alliance française de Calgary participera au Gala de reconnaissance des femmes le samedi 9 mars, organisé par le Portail de l’Immigration Association, en partenariat avec la Coalition des Femmes de l’Alberta.

 ***

🎉The Embassy of France is delighted to present the programming of the Canadian cultural and scientific network on the occasion of International Women's Rights Day. 
🚨Events not to be missed!

📍The Consulates General of France, Germany and Switzerland in Vancouver invite you to the BCIT Tech Collider for an inspiring evening on Wednesday, March 6 from 5 to 7 pm with STEM researchers and industry professionals. 

📍In Ottawa, don't miss the opening of the "NOLA Project" exhibition on March 8 at 6 p.m. in the gallery of the Alliance Française d'Ottawa (352 rue MacLaren). 

📍In Toronto, on March 8 from 6:30 to 8 p.m., at the Alliance Française de Toronto, take part in an exchange between Fatou Toufah Jallow, feminist activist and author of "The Woman who inspired an African #MeToo movement", and Nawel, consultant with the association Oasis Centre des Femmes.

📍The Alliance française de Calgary will be taking part in the Women's Recognition Gala on Saturday, March 9, organized by the Portail de l'Immigration Association, in partnership with the Coalition des Femmes de l'Alberta.

@tylerperry story deeply resonates with me. His candid interview with @oprah in 2010 marked a pivotal moment in my own journey of healing and self-discovery. Perry’s words echoed in my mind, unlocking a profound understanding of my own past. In that moment, his voice became my voice, offering a glimmer of hope in the midst of my darkest struggles. His courage inspires us to confront our own shadows, embrace vulnerability, and stand in solidarity with survivors. Perry’s story is not just one of survival; it is a testament to the resilience of the human spirit and the enduring power of hope. I have never crossed paths with Tyler Perry, yet his impact on my life is profound. He was the beacon of hope that illuminated my path, for which I will always be grateful.

 #SurvivorStories #HealingJourne #mentalhealth #metoo

Maybe going for a walk? Just around the block? I

f you just get up and move, you'll feel so much better.

DESCRIPTION:
🔍 Neste momento decisivo para os direitos das mulheres e a igualdade de gênero, é essencial reconhecer a influência que nossas vozes e votos podem ter no cenário político. Este carrossel explora a crescente divisão de opiniões entre gêneros na política, um fenômeno que não se limita a uma região, mas é observado globalmente. À medida que nos deparamos com desafios significativos aos direitos femininos, é mais importante do que nunca estar informado e engajado.

🌍 Da divisão ideológica evidenciada entre jovens mulheres e homens à influência do movimento #metoo, passando pela forma como a internet e as redes sociais moldam nossas percepções, este carrossel busca iluminar as nuances dessa questão complexa. Em Portugal, a tendência de votos reflete uma inclinação feminina para políticas que promovem a igualdade e protegem nossos direitos, contrastando com a ascensão de movimentos que buscam reverter essas conquistas.

💬 Deslize para entender mais sobre como a política está sendo moldada por questões de gênero e por que é crucial que façamos nossas vozes serem ouvidas. Juntos, podemos lutar por um futuro em que a igualdade de gênero seja mais do que um ideal - seja uma realidade.

#direitosdasmulheres #igualdadedegênero #políticaegenero #feminismo #votoconsciente #engajamentopolítico #futuroigualitário #daianaallessi #eleicoes2024

Почему я поддерживаю флешмобы #ЯнеБоюсьСказать и #MeToo ?
Продолжение прошлого поста.
Мне 19 - я пережила насильственный вывоз в лес с последующим иŠnaṣïlovãnľêm. Во время этого кошмара я мысленно молилась о том, чтобы меня не убили и не прикопали в том лесу. Или не сделали со мной всё то же самое, что и с Дзюнко Фурутой. 
При этом, добравшись до моего района, я ещё по телефону непринуждённо врала матери, что со мной всё в порядке, в полицию я не обращалась - чтобы не пришлось ретравматизироваться, рассказывая чужим скептично настроенным мужчинам о том, что со мной сделал тот ублюдок. 
Мне 21. На тот момент муж моей родственницы домогался меня и пытался подсадить на нар🐈‍⬛🐈🐱ки. Я ничего и никому не сказала, потому что он был тогда в моей семье на хорошем счету. Наиболее вероятен был бы исход, что он вывернул бы всё в свою пользу и выставил лгуньей меня, в итоге виноватой бы осталась я. Моя родственница в ту пору ему доверяла и любила его. Причём во время приставаний ко мне он имел сволочизм и наглость мне лгать, что моя родственница якобы сама ему изменила, чтобы оправдать своё скотство. 
И это ещё не все всратые истории о мужчинах из моего арсенала всратых историй на реальных событиях.

There is a war at home. If only someone knew?

Me sentí culpable durante tanto tiempo, tuve que luchar tanto para poder contarlo, que ahora nadie podrá parar este fuego que arde por mis adentros para acabar con esta lacra, que nos persigue y además nos esconde, que se considera "tabú". Todos esos prejuicios fueron los que alimentaron mi silencio, las amenazas y "juegos" de mi agresor, las personas que cuando comencé a contarlo decían "¿pero cómo va a ser eso verdad?", "eso suena a fantasioso"... A veces estas palabras entran en mi cabeza y mi ansiedad empieza a apoderarse de mi, de mis pensamientos, de mi vida. A veces siento que no puedo y sin embargo, cada día saco una sonrisa, cada mañana lucho  para poder salir de la cama y las duchas se sienten eternas intentando lavar un cuerpo que se siente demasiado sucio... A veces me gustaría volver a empezar y gritarlo para pedir AYUDA, otras sigo luchando para que no le pase a ningún niñe más 💔😿🫂
LES NIÑES NUNCA MIENTEN ⛈️🫀

Tomorrow night we open FORCE, a new one-woman-play by @dan_brown_rockaway_ . My friend @_amandaferguson came to see a rehearsal last week, and when we were discussing the run afterwords she said: “this story is so important being told through a singular, female voice.” I can’t stop thinking about her words. This play is about a random act of sexual assault and the choices Sarabeth makes in the wake of her healing. So often when these stories are told, even though demonized, we still hear the male voice. He’s still on the stage, taking up space. We still get the other side of the story. I never thought about how powerful it is to hear this story, through one voice, one girl, one truth. When I said yes to being on stage for a whole play all by myself…I never realized I would be saying yes to putting heart to the voices of so many women who need these stories told without the other side. I’m not alone up there afterall. I hope you come to see this play. Opening night is sold out, but we still have a few tickets left for Friday-Sunday. 🎟️ link in bio. 
.
.
.
📸: @vannapilgrim

2b has a long history of presenting Hannah Moscovitch's new works. 'The Russian Play & Mexico City' in 2008/2010, 'East of Berlin' in 2009/2011, 'What a Young Wife Ought To Know' in 2015/17/18, and of course - 'Old Stock: A Refugee Love Story'. Which opened in 2017 and has been touring the world ever since. 

We are thrilled to be presenting Hannah's work once more, with the world premiere of her latest work, 'Red Like Fruit'. A searing interrogation of the many contradictions and complexities of complicity, consent, patriarchy and traumatic memory in the post #MeToo era.

Tickets are on sale now and selling fast - get yours before they're gone, through the link in our bio.

⭐️Life has an uncanny way of throwing unexpected challenges our way, pushing us to the brink of despair. Growing up in a difficult childhood, witnessing alcoholism in my family, battling depression, and experiencing the heart-wrenching loss of a cherished person have shaped the person I am today. In this post, I will share my personal journey of how these adversities have not only changed my life but also transformed my mind in a positive and empowering way.⭐️

// НОВИНКИ ОТ INDIVIDUUM //

Недавно мы получили огрооомную поставку на 100 килограмм книг, так что готовьтесь — в ближайшее время будем много рассказывать о книжных новинках ^_^

Начнем с новинок от любимого независимого издательства «Individuum» 🤍

«Слово пацана. Криминальный Татарстан 1970-2010»
Роберт Гараев

Документальная книга российского журналиста Роберта Гараева о казанском феномене уличных банд, впервые опубликованная в 2020 году. Легла в основу нашумевшего сериала «Слово пацана. Кровь на асфальте», вышедшего на экраны в конце 2023 года.
915₽

«Всё о ней. Бережная гинекология от первой менструации до постменопаузы»
Ольга Крумкач

Акушер-гинеколог и ведущая популярного подкаста «Раздвиньте ноги» дает ответы на большинство вопросов о работе женского организма, показывая, как важен бережный и доверительный подход в самой интимной области медицины.
637₽

«Под фартуком: бессистемное руководство повара с рецептами и эскизами татуировок»
Иван Шишкин

Как устроена жизнь повара? Как выглядит работа ресторана снаружи и изнутри? Что такое вкусная еда и как ее придумывать? На эти и многие другие вопросы отвечает в этой книге один из основателей и идеолог кухни московского ресторана Delicatessen. 
900₽

«Муравечество»
Чарли Кауфман

Jag har läst ”Allt som var mitt - historien som inte får berättas” av Cissi Wallin 

Boken där Cissi berättar om övergreppet hon utsattes för som ung och hur det har påverkat hennes liv. Hur hon upptäckte att många andra kvinnor blivit utsatta av samma man men som skrämts till tystnad. 
När metoo kom till Sverige vågade Cissi tillslut gå ut och berätta vad hon utsatts för och av vem vilket resulterade i att hon åtalades och dömdes för förtal. Justitiekanslern Mari Heidenborg åtalade Cissi och ville att den här boken skulle konfiskeras. Tack och lov vann Cissi och hon gav tillslut ut den på eget förlag då inget bokförlag vågade att ge ut den. 

Vi läste den här boken i vår bokcirkel. Den öppnade mina ögon ett snäpp till för hur män med makt inte drar sig för att utnyttja den, gärna med kvinnor som de har under sig i hierarkin eftersom de sällan vågar anmäla dem. Om rättsväsendet som sviker kvinnorna som blivit våldtagna. Om advokaterna som skrämmer kvinnorna till tystnad. 
#metoo lyfte en oerhört viktig fråga och ledde bl.a. till att vi nu har en samtyckeslag även om den fortfarande inte fungerar som den borde. 
Vi måste uppfostra våra söner till att bli bättre än detta! 

#catrineläser #catrinelaser #alltsomvarmitthistoriensomintefårberättas #alltsomvarmitt #cissiwallin #cissimusic #lästips #boktips #bokcirkel #bokcirkelbok

Over in America, there has been increasing hateful legislation against transgender people proposed and implemented. Such legislation enables and perpetuates hate crimes, including those against children. 

Earlier this month, Nex Benedict, a 16 year old non-binary student and member of the Choctaw nation was brutally attacked in the bathroom at school by their classmates, who had been bullying them for their gender identity. The school didn’t call an ambulance or report the incident to police, and suspended Nex. They died the next day.

Trans people around the world face dangerous transphobia. They face high rates of abuse and assault, and higher barriers to support. This is not just an American problem; it is also the case here in Australia. 

Children deserve safety. Trans people deserve safety. 

Rest in peace, Nex 🩷🤍🩵

Only my third book for 2024, as she has been in a reading SLUMP. 5/5⭐️

I have been putting off this read, because I was scared to see myself in its pages. Sometimes it is shamefully easier to close your ears and hearts to survivors and their stories, because to sit with them in their pain can be challenging. I had to take breaks during this, but I am glad I read it. Beautifully written, incredibly strong and sad, and angry, and hopeful.

“ How much was I expected to take, to absorb and ignore, while they yelled and clicked their tongues, so freely, with no fear of being confronted. Was I stubborn for wanting to walk, was I asking too much?”

Nothing pisses us off more than when people say that sexual assault is not an issue, or it’s not that bad, or it doesn’t happen that often. So many social justice issues are shrouded in ignorance by communities. Many people do not take the time to understand the true issues society faces when it comes to sexual violence and the horrible impacts that face survivors. We need to continue to fight for what is right and fight for education so people start taking this more seriously. #sexualassault #sexualassaultawareness #survivors #fightforwhatsright #education #metoo

⚠️ ROOM CHANGE: UCC 290 (McKellar Room)

Join us for a conversation about the weaponization of #defamation lawsuits against survivors of sexual violence. 

PANELISTS: 
🔸️ Dr. Mandi Gray (Trent University), assistant professor & anti-violence activist. Author of "Suing for Silence: Sexual Violence and Defamation".

🔸️Anju Fujioka, sexual assault lawyer & LISA supervising lawyer.

Moderated by Chanèle Rioux-McCormick, lawyer, McKenzie Lake & LISA co-founder

🎟 FREE ADMISSION. RSVP to the event for your chance to win a free signed copy of the book! LINK IN BIO

🍕 Light refreshments served.

ABOUT THE BOOK: The arrival of the #MeToo movement was long overdue, putting sexual violence in the spotlight and opening up public discussion of the problem. It also sparked a global anti-feminist backlash. In Suing for Silence, Mandi Gray critically examines how abusive men use defamation lawsuits as a weapon against anyone who attempts to hold them accountable. 

There will be an opportunity for audience Q&A and a meet and greet with the author.

We will be accepting cash donations at the event to help support LISA.

Aino. Aino-Neito. Aino-Sisko. Aino-Tytär. Kalevalan kaunis nainen, joka hukuttautui sillä ei halunnut naimisiin sen kanssa, joka hänelle annettiin. Teki kuolemasta kauniin, karun ja koskettavan & jätti jäljen kertomukseen Kalevalassa, tämänkin päivän puheissa ja ajankohtaisissa ankeuksissa. 
 
” Neito Aino,
Aino-neito hukuttautuu
vaimoksi tahdo ei,
siksi henkensä hukuttaen vei,
ei tahdota turvata tutisevaa,
ei saapua suojaksi sopenkululle,
itkien kotiin vie,
oli alla mikä tahansa tie,
ainoasta alun saanut,
naisen, neidon, siskon luonut,
oman taulun Aino Ateneumiin saanut,
kulkee kun metsässä,
istuu kiven kärjessä,
mukana maasta veteen uppoaa,
kanssa sen hukuttautuu,
itkee koska ei tahdo naimisiin,
nyt kyyneleet sekoittuvat veden viemisiin,
tahtoo hän kanssa kalojen hääjuhliin ”
Emmi-Reetta <3

” Kasvo, neito, minussa mielin, Älä muissa nuorissoissa, Nuorisossa kaunihissa, Kasvos kaioisa somissa, Veny verka vaattehissa. ”
- Hirttäytyneen neidon runosta, ” Anni tytti, Aino neiti ”

- Runo Kalevalasta & ainoasta sisaresta

Kuten Kalevalaan liittyen Elsa Heporauta joka oli valaistuvan viisas, kaunis & kunnianhimoinen sielu, heikompien puolesta tulisesti taistelija, kirjailija, puhuja, tekijä, luoja, ennen kaikkea ihminen.

- Elsa Heporauta

#CollectiveStrength #FightInjustice #MeTooMovement #SocialChange #Activism #EqualityForAll #CommunityAction #TogetherWeCan

We confront the unfortunate  reality that for every 15 Black women who endure the trauma of rape, only 1 feels empowered to report her assault. 

This disparity underscores the systemic barriers and pervasive stigma that hinder survivors from seeking justice and support. It’s a reminder of the urgent need to dismantle structures of oppression and cultivate a culture of belief, support, and empowerment for all survivors. 

We stand with those silenced by fear and systemic injustice, committed to amplifying their voices and advocating for systemic change. Together, we strive for a world where every survivor feels safe, heard, and valued 💙

Una quantità di umorismo e ironia, una varietà di toni e ritmi, una tale vitalità che ci si può solo augurare che sia visto da molti più spettatori di quelli che ne hanno avuto finora la fortuna." Franco Cordelli - Il Corriere della sera-
“Non abbiamo semplicemente e assistito ad uno spettacolo... il pubblico è stato coinvolto, rispondendo alle domande... sorseggiando un bicchierino di whiskey… fino a lasciarsi andare ad una standing ovation con gli occhi velati di lacrime….conferma una grande artista... scrittrice, regista e coinvolgente interprete dei suoi personaggi e del suo "fare teatro" che ormai porta in scena con grande successo di pubblico e che noi apprezziamo ogni volta. Dopo l'enorme successo ottenuto lo spettacolo replicherà nuovamente al teatro Lo Spazio dal 1 al 3 marzo 2024”Silvia Scalamonti- Il Foyer

On this day 4 years ago my children & I were at our favorite restaurant enjoying the day. 

Thank goodness instagram has archived some of my memories. My old Facebook was disabled by family court & I lost all my memories of my years as a single mommy with my kids. 

Never thought in this picture that I would lose custody. Never ever crossed my mind that I would be banned from my children. 

I will get them back & we will be compensated for these years of torture & pain. This never should have happened. 

There is a war at home. If only someone knew?

The #MeToo movement has put sexual harassment in the spotlight, but it is definitely not a new occurrence.

In a nationwide study conducted by the UC San Diego Center on Gender Equity and Health, 81% of women reported experiencing some form of sexual harassment and/or assault in their lifetime. 38% of these women reported the offenses happening in their workplace or school.

Being the victim of sexual harassment in the workplace can have a devastating impact mentally and emotionally on a person. No one should have to face the burdens of workplace harassment alone.

If you feel you have been harassed or mistreated in the workplace, call me today to set up a case evaluation at 423-406-1151.

Now that we're cruising through our early 30s, one thing we'd scream at our younger selves is: choose and take care of yourself first, follow your dreams ( they will change & that’s okay), don’t chase or beg people to treat you how you deserve to be treated, don’t waste your love and effort bending backwards for people that you’re disposable to. 

You are the main character of your life, give yourself a big smooch 💋in the mirror: you deserve to feel safe, loved, and validated.
 Love Angie & Kat ❤️

Relationships aren't set in stone, they can shift and evolve over time. While healthy relationships can bring us closer, unhealthy ones may start to exhibit concerning behaviours such as threats, control, or even physical aggression. 

These signs can sometimes be subtle, masked by the initial excitement of a new connection. Here are some signs of a healthy relationship and red flags that indicate potential issues. 

Remember, while relationships naturally evolve, they should never compromise your safety or independence. Healthy relationships are built on respect, open communication, and mutual understanding.

本篇為騎腳踏車被機車騎士乘機猥褻的朋友
投稿分享作筆錄的經驗

：「我很不幸也很幸運，我被摸屁股後面一段就是派出所，我有記得車號、安全帽顏色、車色、車型，所以有找到對方、監視器有拍到，已報警、提告。

但真的過程太煎熬了，我目前還沒有辦法再重述我遇到的事情⋯⋯ 真的是夢魘，不想再回想，我現在騎腳踏車還是會害怕別人靠近⋯⋯」

We continue to honor Black History Month by highlighting Tarana Burke founder of the #MeTooMovement in 2006 to support women who have experienced sexual assault. Through sharing her own experience Burke helped other women, especially black, share their stories and help a movement that encourages an end to sexual assault

Le molestie online si fanno sempre più sofisticate e pericolose, soprattutto per i giovanissimi. Secondo un sondaggio, il 59% degli adolescenti statunitensi ha avuto almeno un’esperienza diretta di molestie online.
Nel corso del tempo, le piattaforme hanno promesso interventi più o meno risolutori, che però si sono rivelati inefficaci.
Si è parlato di verificare l’età dell’utente tramite carta di credito o documento d’identità, o con il riconoscimento facciale; ma un bambino può usare le carte di credito o d’identità che trova in casa, e i sistemi di riconoscimento facciale potrebbero non calcolare bene l’età.
Anche i meccanismi di parental control sono facili da aggirare: su Instagram per esempio molti minori hanno aperto account business per evitare la verifica dell’età. 
Peccato che quel tipo di profilo sia di default visibile a tutta la comunità online. 
E le minacce non sono solo nei social. 
EpicGames, casa produttrice del famosissimo videogioco Fortnite, è stata multata per aver raccolto i dati dei videogiocatori minorenni e averli indotti a fare acquisti in Rete senza verificare che ci fosse la supervisione di un genitore.
Una cosa è certa: i minori continuano a vedere contenuti inappropriati e a subire molestie e tentativi di adescamento, quindi le misure adottate dalle piattaforme sono più una facciata che un meccanismo di protezione funzionante.
Fintanto che non si avrà la piena – e reale – collaborazione da parte delle Big Tech, le norme rischiano di rimanere inapplicate.

https://www.agendadigitale.eu/sicurezza/molestie-ai-minori-in-aumento-inutili-le-contromisure-dei-social/

Book 5 of 2024: Last year I read (and loved) “The Husbands” by Chandler Baker, and after that I added this book to my TBR. This book is “Big Little Lies” plus the #MeToo movement. A group of women in an office with their secrets, a spreadsheet of sexual offenders, mothers working full-time jobs and raising kids. The last element was common from The Husbands and I am a fan of how Chandler Baker describes the experience in such a universal language. 
I am not too fond of non-linear storytelling generally, and this book relies on that a lot to keep the secrecy about certain events. Blame it on my worldliness or the predictability of the story, I was able to figure out the “secrets” before these unraveled on the pages. This is not to say that I did not enjoy the book. 
The story seemed very regular to me, but it deserves telling because I am sure this is only a woman’s experience. There are still people (read: men AND women) who refuse to believe women when they are sexually harassed. In fact, this book shows the mental dilemma of one of the central characters when one of her work friends expects her support against a senior, while she is debating why she was never harassed at work. 
The book has universal truth bombs about harassment at work across departments, socio-economic strata, and industries. The female friendships, seemingly unconditional, are not all rosy in this book. These are real, imperfect women with betrayals, jealousies, and other myriad human emotions towards other women. 
Overall, an entertaining book which kept me invested in the imperfect characters and their pursuits.

CW: Sexual abuse, harassment, coercion, retaliation

A recent lawsuit has been filed against Disney by an employee, identified as Jane Doe, after the company concealed sexual misconduct by former executive Nolan Gonzales, and retaliated against her with a demotion.

She revealed that management repeatedly ignored complaints about Gonzales, allowing him to harass women without consequences due to his revenue-generating role. The lawsuit states that Gonzales assaulted Jane Doe multiple times in 2017 using drugs and coercion, with threats to release intimate videos if she resisted. 

Despite previous complaints, Gonzales reportedly stepped down in 2022 only after additional harassment reports surfaced. 

This lawsuit emphasizes the critical need for large corporations and studios to prioritize employee protection, and the importance of implementing robust policies to address complaints promptly and impartially. Today, and always, we stand with Jane Doe, survivors of Nolan Gonzales, and with all survivors and Silence Breakers.

#HireSurvivors #Hollywood #HireSurvivorsHollywood #Survivors #MeToo #MeTooMovement

DESCRIPTION:
• JUDITH GODRÈCHE, LA RUPTURE • 🐹

_ La différence fondamentale de Judith Godrèche avec les autres actrices qui ont parlé, avec Adèle Haenel ou Rose McGowan pour citer les premières ici et là-bas avec #metoo, c’est qu’elle a rompu le silence par la fiction avant même de passer par les réseaux sociaux, la presse et les médias. Passée derrière la caméra, elle a su utiliser l’art de la série télé pour se réapproprier ce qu’on lui a dérobé lorsqu’elle a tourné adolescente. Actrice autrice, elle casse l’omerta avec les mêmes armes et le même outil que ses abuseurs : la fiction. L’offensive est de l’intérieur, la vérité vient de l’autofiction et le salut — encore — du cinéma, meilleur témoin de lui-même.

NB - en ligne à lire in extenso, version longue. 

(lien en bio)
https://www.liberation.fr/culture/cinema/judith-godreche-une-transmutation-en-fictions-20240223_O2KM2YSDPBCBXO7J6LTC5AQMKQ/

Sa série est formidable. Tellement d’humour touchant, d’autodérision. À voir asap !!! ❤","En terme de aussi création le film de #andreabescond les Chatouilles est je trouve très puissant..","👏👏","La diversité des modes d’action pour se faire entendre a été indispensable, que ce soit à travers une œuvre ou l’explosion de la colère. Adèle Haenel en quittant les Césars a enfoncé les portes. Merci à toustes pour leurs manières différentes d’exprimer ces viols, abus et cette domination insupportables. Une façon de nous laisser toustes nous reconnaître dans ces histoires qui ont les mêmes racines, de montrer qu’elles sont partout et sous diverses formes et que nos façons multiples de les combattre sont légitimes et importantes.","Très beau, très belle façon de présenter le travail de réparation qu'a fait l'actrice/réalisatrice @judithgodreche1 ❤️ C'est en cela, aussi, que sa parole dépasse l'espace individuel d'une histoire et rejoint un espace collectif, celui, notamment, de toutes les petites filles/adolescentes/jeunes femmes abusées 🙏","Oui et c’est très réussi.Elle est légitime et considérée de par son talent de réalisatrice, cela donne donne du poids et du sens à sa parole si sensible et intelligente.Les voilà bien embêtés…"]

Today I was the bravest i’ve been in a long time 🤍

Today I told my mam about what happened to me as a child, as a teenager and as a young adult at the hands of different perpetrators 

My brain told me she was going to respond with blame, shame, anger and disappointment. It turned out that I was actually just projecting those emotions onto her because thats how I sometimes feel within myself 🤍

She responded with love, acceptance and said she was proud of me 🥺 she told me I was brave, that she understood and that none of those events were my fault. She told me she was glad I told her if it meant part of my healing. She said she was happy I told her and gave me a big cuddle. She told me she believed me

I feel like this is one of the biggest steps i’ve taken yet and after 17 years of continuous silence, i’ve finally been able to come clean 🤍

We talked then about my mental health through the years that she lived through with me. My anorexia diagnosis as a teen, the two years of self harm and suicidal tendencies that came in my late teens and my most recent CPTSD diagnosis. She told me she loved me and that she’s proud of how far I have come despite the trauma 🤍

The validation i’ve wanted for so long, but been so scared to seek out🤍 so glad I was brave today 🤍

Ce vendredi 8 mars, nous serons en grève. Nous serons fermés, et par conséquent notre permanence du vendredi matin ne seront pas assurée à Bordeaux.

🌸 8 MARS : Journée Internationale de lutte pour les droits des femmes et des personnes des minorités de genre 🌸

Le 8 mars, nous levons nos voix pour dénoncer les oppressions patriarcales, racistes et capitalistes qui persistent dans notre société. Rejoignez-nous dans la grève générale féministe, car il est temps de prendre le contrôle de nos vies ! 💪✊

💼 Pourquoi la grève ?

Au travail, à la maison, à l'école : nous interrompons toute activité productive et reproductive. Nous désertons les lieux de consommation pour mettre fin aux cycles de violence et d'oppression. En solidarité avec nos adelphes du monde entier, nous disons NON aux attaques du gouvernement réactionnaire, raciste et misogyne !

🚺 Face aux défis actuels :

🚫 Stop aux violences sexistes et sexuelles : 1% des viols sont condamnés. #MeToo est partout, mais l'impunité persiste.
💼 Des travailleurs·euses égaux, des salaires décents : pour une égalité salariale, la revalorisation des métiers féminisés et la retraite à 60 ans.
📚 Des services publics pour nos besoins : protégeons l'éducation, la santé et les victimes de violences sexistes.
🤰 Notre corps, nos choix : défendons le droit à l'avortement et la contraception et l'accessibilité universelle aux transitions de genre.

🌐 Rejoignez-nous le 8 mars :

🌍 Prenons la rue, investissons tous les espaces !
🤝 Construisons des alliances locales et internationales !
⛔ Arrêtons tout pour un monde féministe !

On vous donne rendez-vous en 💥manif💥 le vendredi 8 mars à 12h, Place de la Victoire à Bordeaux avec @agfeministegironde

✨ Solidarité et résistance !

Ensemble, exigeons un monde où toutes les voix sont entendues, où toutes les vies sont valorisées. Rejoignez la grève féministe le 8 mars et contribuons à la construction d'un avenir égalitaire pour toustes !

Here are some of the war crimes committed by the Nazi- Terror organization Hamas: 🇵🇸⚠️

💔At least 10 hostages have been murdered in captivity. Those who survived faced starvation, resulting in a loss of at least 20% of their body weight. Moreover, they were subjected to inhumane bathroom conditions, with waits of up to 2 hours just to use the facilities. Upon their release back to Israel, these survivors were found to be suffering from scabies, lice infestations, and severe eye problems.💔

💔But most chillingly, the returning hostages have reported more instances of rape and sexual assault and rape during their captivity. These heinous acts constitute egregious war crimes and serve as a stark reminder of the brutality perpetrated by Hamas. Such atrocities cannot go unnoticed or unpunished.❣️

🎤🔯🇮🇱While the world discusses justice and resistance, it's crucial to discern between legitimate forms of resistance and outright atrocities. What we are witnessing is not resistance but rather abhorrent acts of violence against innocent civilians. We stand firm in our commitment to resistance through peaceful means such as demonstrations, writing, and the press. However, we cannot condone or ignore the inhumane actions carried out under the guise of resistance.

🙏🌍🎧It's imperative not to turn a blind eye to these atrocities in the name of democracy. History has taught us the devastating consequences of such indifference. Let us uphold the principles of democracy while unequivocally condemning acts of cruelty and injustice perpetrated against the innocent.💫

So pleased to share that I've recently been approved as an Approved Counsellor for victims of crime under the Victims Services Approved Counselling Service (ACS) in NSW. 

This scheme gives approved clients up to 22 hours of free sessions for counselling related to the psychological injuries sustained as a result of their experience of crime. 

My specialties relate to victims and survivors of:
adult survivors of child seggsual abuse
recent seggsual assault 
young people (16-21) 
members of the LGBTIQ+ community 

To see if you're eligible for the scheme head to: https://victimsservices.justice.nsw.gov.au/victims-services/how-can-we-help-you/victims-support-scheme/eligibility-criteria.html

To find my profile link under the scheme head to: https://victimsservices.justice.nsw.gov.au/victims-services/how-can-we-help-you/victims-support-scheme/counselling.html#Find4 

Delighted that I'm now able to offer access to this kind of support with less financial barriers.

DESCRIPTION:
🌟She Said by Jodi Kantor and Megan Twohey🙎‍♀️

Two women behind #MeToo Movement. The journey, the risk and the secrets these two women, together with the survivors and victims took to investigate and unravel one of the ugliest unspoken truth about a producer and his acts. Kantor and Twohey went to great length to give voice to the victims and survivors not because they are great journalist, but because they believe in what they are doing, and while reading this, I know they would go to the end of the earth to uncover all of the secrets, lies, abuse, continuous sexual harassment and clutters of NDAs that were going on behind the curtain. 

This book makes me mad. Really mad and angry at the world. This is one of the must read books for everyone. At least you’ll know how far people would go just for power and to cover up their unlawful acts.

An Instagram post by an 18-year-old girl from Prayagraj has now led to a trial court in the city awarding 20 years jail term to a man above 60 years of age. 

Uploaded in April 2019 — in the aftermath of a MeToo movement that had gripped the country — her post was a detailed account of her sexual abuse by her private tutor, Sunil Dua, over a few months between October 2013 and February 2014. She was in class 7 then and was 13 years old.

It was her post that alerted her parents to what she had gone through. 

Talking to ThePrint, her father now recalls that as soon as he read her post, they decided to file a complaint against Dua. 

“We did not allow any time to lapse after her post. There was no time spent in any discussions,” he said. The FIR was filed on 14 April 2019, and thus, the trial began.

During the hearing, the father also read out a statement to the court. “If a paedophile is hidden, he can damage so many lives. I told the judge that a paedophile is like a serial killer. He (Dua) was a loner, never got married and he never revealed his address,” he told ThePrint.

Read more at link in bio/IG story

Report by @ApoorvaMandhani

最根本的方式就是提高人們犯案的成本
不隱忍、並且讓犯人面對法律責任
真正的保護自己不該是日常活得小心翼翼

無法真的照以上步驟進行也不要自責
當下會突然腦袋一片空白、動彈不得是正常的

Contre les violences sexuelles et les questions de harcèlements, notre responsabilité est collective. Ce bouleversement, cette prise de conscience, nous l'appelions de nos vœux depuis longtemps. Soyons présent·e·s !

#metoo #metoomovement #rassemblement #cesar2024

1/3
Un combat qui n’a pas d’autre genre que celui de la honte.

En 2014, je rejoins comme beaucoup un site de casting à la mode qui promet des rencontres professionnelles et des événements conviviaux pour développer son réseaux. J’ai pu ainsi être convié à un rendez-vous avec un grand producteur de spectacles et de musique. Dans son bureau, je lui fais écouter mes chansons, lire mes textes et lui montre mes photos. Il est à l’écoute et m’encourage à travailler avec lui sur mes projets. C’est pour moi, une opportunité unique jusqu’à ce qu’il me raccompagne jusqu’à la sortie. Là, je me retourne pour le remercier et lui dire au revoir. Il me pousse dans l’angle de la porte et du mur pour m’embrasser. Je sens sa langue râpeuse dans ma bouche sans pouvoir bouger. Je le repousse et le regarde avec stupéfaction. 
Mon caractère me donne cependant la force de lui répondre : « Si vous voulez être un cliché du show business, c’est votre problème. Mais ce sera sans moi. »
Par la suite, à chaque fois que je postulais  pour ses projets, je n’étais jamais retenu, ni convié.
La seule fois où j’ai pu auditionner, le directeur de casting en lisant mon CV, questionna mon expérience : « Tu as sucé qui pour faire tout ça? ». Un sous-entendu qui a laissé des traces. 
Démontrant ainsi que si tu dis « non », tu es exclu ou pire, suspecté d’être à l’initiative d’une promotion canapé. 
Quelques temps plus tard, je travaillais avec un autre producteur. Malgré une réputation sulfureuse, il ne tenta rien à mon encontre. J’ai une tendance à donner ma confiance sans faille, jusqu’à preuve du contraire. Et malgré ce qu’on me rapportait, j’ai également souvent été témoin d’attitudes de jeunes éphèbes, conscients de leur pouvoir de séduction, stimuler les plus vils instincts chez des hommes puissants capable d’exaucer leurs souhaits, pour lui laisser le bénéfice du doute.

Future; this is to you. 

How can flowers blossom
tress can grow
water can flow freely, without my curious mind?

How can the sun shine so bright,
how can I ever look at nature wondering, 
where do I fit in this narrative?

Yet, why is the ego in conflict with its own home?
Why do we decide to deny, 
when all I we have every done is taken
the fruit from nature,
without ever wondering why should I?

Somewhere down the line,
I know we will find a way to rejoice— 
just as it was intended was our first glimpse with you
but until then,
there are still many rivers to cross
and too many lessons to be learned

Dr. Karyn Purvis, renowned child expert, would say that every child has three birthrights:

1. There is a safe place.
2. There are safe adults.
3. Someone thinks you are precious.

More than 600,000 children are confirmed to be victims of some form of abuse (neglect, physical, sexual, emotional). The best way to stop child abuse is to prevent it from ever happening. While this sounds like common sense, it really is the most effective strategy to eradicate child abuse.

La emblemática revista francesa dedica un número especial a la presencia de las mujeres en el quehacer fílmico a través de una serie de conversaciones con cineastas, actrices, guionistas, investigadoras, activistas y críticas cinematográficas galas.
La edición titulada “¡Las mujeres están aquí!” sirve como una reflexión de los avances del movimiento feminista en la industria audiovisual a partir del  movimiento #metoo de 2017, pero también funciona para vislumbrar los nuevos desafíos que enfrentan como género.
El análisis se realiza a través de cuatro ejercicios que incluyen:
-Un cuestionario presentado a 17 cineastas
-Una mesa redonda con editores de la revista 
- 5 entrevistas con actrices francesas: Virginie Efira, Léa Drucker, Hafsia Herzi, Louise Chevillotte y Judith Godrèche
- Una conversación entre guionistas de dos generaciones, Naïla Guiguet y Julie Peyr.
Otros textos que enriquecen la publicación son una actualización sobre los avances legales realizados por la productora Julie Billy; un análisis del libro “Gaslight” de Hélène Frappat; un texto teórico muy claro que cuestiona la pertinencia de la noción de “mirada femenina”; documentos comentados por el Centro Simone de Beauvoir (archivo pero también creación de películas feministas, en particular las de Delphine Seyrig y Carole Roussopoulos); comentarios de los programadores del festival sobre la difusión de películas dirigidas por mujeres y una breve historia de la presencia del cine femenino y de las críticas femeninas en las páginas de Cahiers.
Una edición que rompe esquemas y que se revela como una invitación a investigadoras, filósofas, escritoras y técnicas para que hagan suyas las páginas de “Cahiers du Cinema”, quizá la revista más importante en la historia del séptimo arte.
#DireccióndeFotografía #CineFoto #Producción #CTT #SeHaceCine
#Cinefotografía  #Cinefotographer  #CTTRentadeEquipodeCine  #cine #cahiersducinema

DESCRIPTION:
Anna tells her story of teen dating violence when, as a freshman, she was “instantly hooked” by a varsity athlete who made her feel great—until he didn’t. Read Anna’s story via our highlights or linktree. 

Looking back on her traumatic experience, Anna wants others to recognize the warning signs of teen dating and how to get help. She recommends the @sashclubs “Teen Dating Violence” Power Topic presentation, via our Power Topics highlight or linktree. 

Anna @feelinghealingenhanced, like many survivors of abuse by male athletes, found it pointless to report because the school ignored victims. If Anna’s school had taken the proper steps to support reporting students, she could have avoided years of trauma. Schools must create a safe environment for all students, take reports compassionately, and act quickly to stop the harassment. Too often schools don’t--so students are denied their right to an education free from sexual harassment as guaranteed by Title IX, a federal civil rights law. 

Use @ssaisorg toolkits (in our highlights) to ensure your school is taking the required steps to protect students.

Have an interest in learning about the intersectionality of disabilities and sexualized violence? We have just the resource for you! 

Join us on your lunch break for our free webinar, "Disability & Sexualized Violence:
Exploring the Intersection" on Wednesday, March 12th, 2024 at 12pm - 1pm. If you can't make it on the day, still be sure to register and you will receive a recording of the webinar afterwards. 

Disability & Sexualized Violence:
People living with disabilities, both mental and physical, self-report having experienced sexualized violence at alarming rates. The exact numbers are difficult to determine, as this intersection is often not studied or researched. Educating those living with disabilities about consent and violence is equally (if not more?) important, as well as the folks that support them. Learn more about this particular intersection, and strategies for educating youth and young adults about consent and violence, in this lunch-n-learn webinar.

Il faut montrer la réalité. Il faut dénoncer. Il faut être honnête. 

Se battre c’est quotidien. Mais l’indécence institutionnelle et judiciaire nous tue petit à petit.  Certaines y ont laissé la vie, sont mortes de chagrin ou n’ont plus supporté l’atrocité de cette vie et ont préféré en finir.

Les vies de nos enfants sont nos priorités. 

Plus de fête (anniversaire, noël…), plus de vie.

Essayer de dormir, essayer de manger, bosser, payer les frais de justice. 

Certaines vivent chez leur famille, d’autres dans des foyers pour femmes voire même dans la rue. 

C’est ça nos vies en 2024 ! Être une maman protectrice en 2024 et depuis des dizaines d’années c’est voir sa vie basculer. 

Rien n’arrêtera jamais une vraie maman. 

Vos soutiens me font tenir. Merci à vous mes ami(e)s. Merci aux célébrités qui prennent part activement à ce combat contre l’enfer que vivent nos enfants. Oui la génération future. Quel avenir ont-ils ?

Beaucoup me demandent : comment tu fais pour tenir ? Ma réponse «  je n’ai strictement jamais menti je peux me regarder dans un miroir et me dire oui tu as pris la bonne décision tu as porté la parole de ton fils. »

Je suis fière de me battre pour toi mon fils.

Mais cela doit être dit. Parce que j’ai fait condamner l’ASE les institutions et la Justice, car ton placement a été reconnu illégal, t’ont puni pour me faire taire. 

Placé chez celui que tu as désigné coupable. 

Me taire : JAMAIS ! Ps : merci à ceux qui ne m’ont pas cru, cela m’a permis de voir qui étaient les personnes dont je devais m’entourer. 
#mamancomblée #mamansolo #mamanblogueuse #mamandegarçons #metoomovement #metooinceste #ase #metooase✊🤍 #nevergiveup #neverbrokeagain #neverforgotten

I Like to Watch by Emily Nussbaum. This collection of Pulitzer Prize–winning Nussbaum’s favourite columns she’s written over the years is every TV lover’s dream. Beginning with how Buffy the Vampire Slayer turned her into a TV critic and then running through columns about The Sopranos, Girls, Adventure Time, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt, LOST, Hannibal, black-ish, and soooo many more, it’s a romp through the last 20 or so years of television. Occasionally you’ll reach a story where there’s a wee bit of a cringe factor due to stories that wouldn’t come out until later—Joss Whedon is still a geek god, for instance—and despite the actual book being published after most of those stories had broken, I appreciated her just leaving them within the context of their own time. Nussbaum has always been a brilliant TV critic, and it’s rather refreshing to go back to a time that’s, well, not now. Sometimes she’ll drop little things into the middle of an interview that had me laughing out loud—my absolute favourite was the blink-and-you’d-miss-it nugget that Jenji Kohan, the creator of Orange Is the New Black and GLOW, has a pitbull named Gail Feldman… which made my husband and I LOL and decide we’re naming our future cats Morty Sherman, Devorah Goldberg, and Judy Feinstein. But the heart of this book is a remarkable essay that lands smack in the middle of it, one that she wrote specifically for the book, called “Confessions of the Human Shield.” In it she addresses the very thing I mentioned above: that sometimes people do bad things, and the wrong people—often fans or TV critics—get caught in the crossfire for ever having liked them in the first place, something all of us have felt as fans at one point or another, especially in the past 20 years. This 50-page essay addresses specifically the #MeToo movement and Harvey Weinstein accusations, and how the two caused a tsunami that would spiral through what she did for a living—in all the best and worst ways. It’s jaw-droppingly good, and if you only read one part of this book, make it that essay. But I hope you read the entire book, which is an amazing look back at the TV shows we love, and why. #bookstagram

DESCRIPTION:
"This intersection of women, violence, and purity has resulted in more than victim blaming and the idolization of predators like GGW - the purity myth is significantly changing the cultural and political landscape as it relates to violence and women. Women have always been blamed for sexual violence done to them; that's nothing new. But in an allegedly post-feminist world, where rape and domestic violence are supposed to be universally reviled, arguments that overtly (or stealthily) blame women, or dismiss violence against them, have that much more power. Because who in this day and age would say that rape is a good thing? Or that a woman just got what was coming to her? No one; instead, today's rape apologism comes wrapped in the rhetoric of equality - That's what makes it different, and so dangerous.

In a 2008 Los Angeles Times article, for example, reporter Heather Mac Donald wrote that there simply is no rape problem on college campuses. In response to a Harvard woman's story about being raped while she was drunk, Mac Donald's wrote that to hold her 'without responsibility requires stripping women of volition and moral agency.'...

This insidious argument about 'responsibility' is having an acute effect on the way all women talk about rape. The very notion of what rape is is being debated - and not in a progressive or useful way....

Of course, many women don't call their assaults rape, for myriad reasons - perhaps because of the shame and stigma attached to sexual assault, or maybe they shy away from the word because they don't want to admit something so awful happen to them. But whatever the reason, it doesn't change the reality of what happened - It doesn't change the fact that someone raped them.

As dangerous as Sessions Stepp's claim that there is such a thing as 'gray rape' is her insinuation that some women are too empowered to be victims...Claims like these, and playing with language without regard for women's experiences, have real life consequences."

Author @jessicavalenti
From #thepuritymyth
Artist Red K.Elders @rkelders.art

["Lycéens et apprentis au spectacle vivant"]

Le dispositif "Lycéens et apprentis au spectacle vivant", c'est une découverte de l'univers du spectacle, mais c'est aussi une ouverture sur le monde et une invitation à la réflexion.

Bravo aux lycéens de terminale STAV du lycée de l'horticulture et du paysage de Tournus (71), qui après avoir reçu la petite forme "Figaro-ci, Figaro-là" de @leylarabih_grenierneuf , ont travaillé sur le thème des agressions sexuelles et du viol, et ont produit par petits groupes des affiches, panneaux et poèmes, exposés ensuite dans le lycée. 👏

Malgré beaucoup d'incertitudes, le Sénat a adopté ce soir le texte de "compromis" inscrivant dans la Constitution la "liberté garantie pour les femmes" de recouvrir à l'interruption volontaire de grossesse. Si le texte est jugé insuffisant par plusieurs associations, notamment en ce qu'il se réfère à la "liberté" et non plus au "droit", l'initiative est largement saluée, notamment pour lutter contre le danger de la montée de l'extrême-droite qui met à mal le droit des femmes à disposer de leurs corps. Le Congrès se réunira à Versailles le 4 mars prochain pour finaliser le vote.

Meet-me-Mitwoch
Zeichnungen von mir

Kreide auf Ingrees-Papier entstanden ca 1988 in Hohenstein/SH

Dies war ein Geburtstagsgeschenk an meinen Vater, welcher früher mal ganz viele Öl-Bilder von Clowns gemalt hatte (Malen nachnZahlen).

Die Geschichte dieses Clowns ist, das er sich fragt, ob er das tolle Eis essen soll, weil es dann ja weg wäre. Es ist ein Bildnis mangelnder Selbstliebe und das Leben in folge dessen, nicht genießen zu können.

Clowns sind in der Kunst oft tragische Wesen, die andere Menschen zum Lachen bringen, innerlich aber tief-traurig sind.

Ein berühmter, amerikanischer comedian hatte mal gesagt, er wäre so gut darin, weil er keinem das Gefühl gönnt, was er krankheitsbedingt permanent fühle. Er war depressiv.

#awareness #Respekt #metoo #Depression #mental #Support #clown #Art #chalk

He doesn’t hit me anymore: he hits my kids. He doesn’t hit me: he terrorizes me. He doesn’t hit me: he weaponizes a system against me to legally kidnap my kids.

There is a war at home. If only someone knew? 

❤️🤍💙 🤫❤️‍🩹💔

DESCRIPTION:
Filmtipp! "Gegen das Schweigen - Machtmissbrauch bei Theater und Film" ist das Ergebnis von Gesprächen mit mehr als 200 Menschen aus der Theater- und Filmbranche. Wir möchten euch diese Dokumentation empfehlen, in der es nicht nur um Machtmissbrauch, sondern auch um sexualisierte Gewalt geht. Ab sofort in der ARD Mediathek und am 11. März ab 22 Uhr im NDR Fernsehen. (Link in Bio).

Drei Jahre lang haben die NDR-Reporterinnen Zita Zengerling und Kira Gantner zu Machtmissbrauch bei Theater und Film recherchiert. Sie haben sich gefragt, warum gerade diese Branche immer wieder Skandale produziert. Dafür haben sie mit mehr als 200 Menschen gesprochen. Bei einigen Fällen haben sich die Autorinnen entschieden, die Namen der mutmaßlichen Täter zu nennen.

Achtung: Der Film kann für Betroffene überwältigende Gefühle auslösen oder überfordern. Bitte achtet auf Eure Grenzen und wendet Euch bei Bedarf an Freund*innen, Familie oder entsprechende Anlaufstellen. Wir sind für Euch da!

Ma vie est rythmée par la dépression, tout est aléatoire. J'organise pas trop, je prévois pas trop, je fais juste au mieux 🙏🏻

Vc sabia que desde o final do ano passado, graças a luta das mulheres, temos uma Casa de Referência em Cabo Frio?
Sabe o que isso significa? 
Trata-se de um espaço de construção coletiva que tem como objetivo dar suporte jurídico, psicológico e de formação às mulheres em situação de vulnerabilidade.
.
Mas a casa precisa de todos nos para esse sonho virar realidade.
É por isso que em breve estaremos ministrando oficinas solidárias tanto no meu ateliê como na casa @ocupa.inesetienneromeu com o objetivo não só de capacitação, senão também de divulgação e de captação de recursos para novos projetos, obras e mais.
.

DESCRIPTION:
🔴 En unga man som misstänks för en överfallsvåldtäkt vid industriområdet i Timrå i december är frihetsberövad. Nu misstänks han för fler sexualbrott, bland annat våldtäkt mot barn.

🔴 En av de 15-åriga pojkar som i måndags greps som misstänkt för våldtäkt mot en minderårig flicka i Malmö den 16 februari har häktats.

🔴 Efter våldtäkten tog mannen med sig kvinnans kläder och lämnade henne naken i sin bil.

🔴 En elev i Enköping har enligt uppgift utsatts för trakasserier och sexuella övergrepp, bland annat en våldtäkt, av en annan elev under skoltid.

🔴 En äldre man från Kungsbacka kommun har häktats misstänkt för våldtäkt mot barn och grovt sexuellt övergrepp mot barn.

🔴 Under natten mot söndagen ska en man ha våldtagit en kvinna i 20-årsåldern utomhus i centrala Växjö. Enligt polisen skedde våldtäkten på Kungsgatan, precis vid Växjö tingsrätt, efter ett restaurangbesök.

🔴 Mannen förde upp sina fingrar i flickvännens underliv, för att kontrollera om hon hade varit otrogen. Nu dömer Högsta domstolen honom för mindre grov våldtäkt.

🔴 Under lördagen skedde en misstänkt barnvåldtäkt i Malmö.
Åklagaren kan nu bekräfta att det rör sig om en flicka under 15 år som har utsatts för en misstänkt grov gruppvåldtäkt.

Detta är några av de senaste timmarnas och dagarnas nyhetsartiklar. Våldtäkt, våldtäkt, våldtäkt och än mer våldtäkt.
Sätt sexuellt våld och våldtäkt högre upp på den politiska dagordningen! För varje dag läser jag i media om kvinnor och flickor som blivit utsatta för sexuella trakasserier, sexuellt övergrepp och våldtäkt. Varje dag, flera fall, i hela vårt avlånga land och det blir inte färre utan bara värre 💔

#intefärrebaravärre #metoo #womentoremember #wtr #stoppamänsvåld

Teen dating violence takes many forms including psychological aggression: verbal or non-verbal communication to emotionally harm or control another person. It can also include repeated, unwanted attention or contact (like intrusively checking emails and texts) that causes fear or concern for one’s own safety. The many warning signs are included in our @sashclubs Teen Dating Violence Power Topic (via highlights). It offers a fast-moving video “Dating Abuse: Toolkit for Talking to Teens” with scenarios for people of all genders created by @jewishwomenintl. Thanks for collaborating, CEO 
@meredith_jacobs.

"A true-life story - a young girl with hopes and dreams left the local city for the bright lights of London - with highs and lows. A true reader rollercoaster! Vicki’s life story - warts and all is an incredible journey. It has made me question stereotypes whilst experiencing the extreme euphoria along with the downright low points of life in this incredible laid bare book.” - Jo 
 
Like so many others, I wanted to escape my reality. How many of us are doing this even today. 
 
The truth of “the Naked Truth” is that I could never escape it until I allowed myself to accept it. 

Sign up to the waitlist to access a powerful story of hope and healing. I hope it not only inspires you, but also brings you laughter and acknowledgement along the way. 
 
For a sneak peak, and to be first to know the publication date - LINK IN BIO

Stasera il primo dei 4 incontri per immagini e parole che terrò su "DONNE ARTISTE, nonostante tutto" 
Una mia personale ricerca su donne valorose che ancora non hanno il giusto posto nella Storia, 
una rassegna di omissioni dell'ufficialità, di ingiustificate dimenticanze, di colpevoli attribuzioni. 
Nominare vuol dire fare esistere, riconoscere è dare dignità e corretta visione del progresso del mondo. Cancellare dalla Storia è violenza, non c'è Cultura se non c'è memoria."
Gli incontri saranno presso la Sala Consiliare al Castello dei Da Peraga del Comune di Vigonza, ore 20,30
- mercoledì 28 febbraio: Artiste visuali, dagli albori alle soglie del'900
- giovedì 28 marzo: Artiste visuale del '900 e primi 2000 
- mercoledì 24 aprile: Architette e Designers
- giovedì 23 maggio: Fotografe e Cineaste
-Incontri promossi dal Centro Veneto progetti Donna di Padova, Comune di Vigonza, in collaborazione con l'associazione Lottodiognimese 

Tonight the first of the 4 lectures for images and words that I'll hold on "WOMEN ARTISTS, despite everything"
My personal research on valiant women who still don't have their rightful place in history,
a list of official omissions, of unjustified forgetfulness, of fake attributions.
Naming means making one exist, recognizing means giving dignity and a correct vision of the progress of the world. Erasing from history is violence, there is no culture if there is no memory."

The lectures will be in the Council Hall at the Da Peraga Castle of Municipality of Vigonza, 8.30 pm
- Wednesday 28 February: Visual artists, from the beginning to the threshold of the 20th century
- Thursday 28 March: Visual artists of the 20th and early 2000s
- Wednesday 24 April: Architects and Designers
- Thursday 23 May: Photographers and Filmmakers
Lectures promoted by Veneto Women's Projects Center of Padua, Municipality of Vigonza, in collaboration with the Lottodiognimese association.

7 years ago I was on stage at the Oscars with Lady Gaga and activists and survivors from all of the country! Lady Gaga was nominated for an Oscar for her song that was featured on The Hunting Ground, a powerful documentary about campus sexual violence. 

I am so grateful I got to have this experience. I am so grateful I got to connect with so many fellow survivors of sexual violence. I have made so many lasting friendships from this group and now know so many advocates within this space. I now know so many resources that I wish I had access to as a young survivor—but I am also in the position where I have been able to help allot of people through a similar situation. 

If you’re struggling with the aftermath of sexual violence or harassment, please feel free to reach out to me. I will be happy to connect you with some of the great advocates I know. I believe you. There is a way through. ❤️

Also, that amazing tattoo was designed by my incredible friend @jacquelinetlin 
Jackie is one of the most incredibly talented people I have ever met! Her tattoo design, the fire rose unity survivor symbol, has become an icon for survivors all over the world. 
#metoo #metoomovement

#Consent is an important and ongoing conversation. As we learn more and continue to grow the types of conversations we have, it's clear that not everyone really has a clear understanding of what consent really is and how to apply it to everyday conversations. Sometimes it's really easy to talk about the idea as an abstract because we can lay out the black and white definitions. Most people can't make the transition to how it should actually apply in real world situations. It's easy for people to get confused and they have a lot of questions. The problem is that a lot of people still aren't seeking the answers. Some of the largest feedback that I've gotten since putting out my book February 1st is that it's making people look at consent in an entirely new way. They are considering things that they never thought about before. It's important we continue to push the boundaries of our thinking and engage in meaningful conversations about consent. Get your own copy and join the conversation. Together we can take the steps to building a consent culture! It's clear that what we've been doing so far isn't working, we need to try something different. Don't wait to start!
___________________________________________________
Pick up your copy
https://www.exploresextalk.com/product/got-consent/?utm_source=instagram

Catch me Wed 3/6 @reset_boston with @werme.dj and Sat 3/9 @experience.collective with @marelle_music_ and Berlin techno legend @anjaschneiderofficial 🇩🇪

Join me on two special musical journeys to honor and celebrate to the strength, grace, and beauty of the feminine divine.

🌸🌼🌸🌼🌸🌼🌸🌼🌸🌼🌸🌼🌸🌼🌸🌼🌸

Ok, now for the full caption… it’s long… you have been warned 😉  As International Women’s Day approaches and I think about the many incredible women in my life—who in spite of their own difficulties, still make space to comfort, encourage, and challenge me on a daily basis—it would be crazy not to pause to celebrate them. 
Looking back, the past year or so feels like it could contain a decade’s worth of hardships. So many heart-wrenching losses it’s hard to keep track of them all—losing my employment and financial stability to a layoff, my relationship and business partner to a breakup, my reproductive rights and healthcare access to a broken system of governing, my physical autonomy to an industry peer I trusted, and worst of all—losing my ride-or-die companion and best friend of 12-years to cancer. I didn’t think I would survive.  But throughout it all, I was never alone. My sisterhood (by blood and by bond) came through like a force of nature, providing the resilience and strength I needed to navigate my darkest days. They were right there beside me, from carrying me through the losses, to celebrating the triumphs with me as I played my first festival and international gigs, released my first EP, and launched my own party series—their unwavering presence and love were my support system every step of the way.  
As 2024 unfolds, I feel at ease knowing that the foundation of my journey is woven with threads of resilience and perseverance by the strong women who came before me and will carry on after me. Here’s to the women who inspire and empower me every day.  
 #InternationalWomensDay #reproductiverights #handsoffourbodies #genderequality #metoo

DESCRIPTION:
Et hier en fin de journée, Anny Duperey a rétropédalé en publiant ce communiqué :

« Face aux nombreuses réactions sur les réseaux sociaux à propos de mon intervention au sujet de la plainte de Judith Godrèche, et des autres plaintes apparaissant récemment, je tiens à affirmer que :

• Evidemment, Je CONDAMNE toute action de VIOL ou d’abus de pouvoir séducteur - qu’il ait lieu à l’encontre d’adultes et SURTOUT D’ENFANTS ou ADOLESCENTS.

• Ce n’est pas pour rien que je suis marraine depuis plus de 30 ans d’une association en faveur de la défense des enfants !

De même que :
• J’ai touiours défendu ardemment la cause des femmes, à titre personnel et en participant à nombre de manifestations en faveur de cette cause - pour laquelle il y a encore tant à faire. (ce n’est pas par hasard que je fus l’une des premières signataires pour la libération de Jacqueline Sauvage)

Ce que j’ai voulu, très maladroitement, j’en conviens, car il est bénéfique que les victimes s’expriment enfin, après un si long silence, c’est tempérer l’emballement médiatique. »

Des regrets donc, mais pas d’excuses. 

Après cette réponse rédigée par @alexandralamyofficiel, @judithgodreche1 a également tenu à répondre : 

« Non -Anny Duperey- C’est nous qui nous sommes fait taper dessus. Malgré votre égoïsme, votre morale à l’envers, votre ignorance, je ne vous le souhaite pas. Ça fait mal les coups. »

__
#JudithGodreche #AnnyDuperey #MeToo #AlexandraLamy

Shanny Payton is a comedian with hundreds of thousands of followers. She’s an extremely funny human being, but she has a darker origin story. She grew up in a church cult, and she has been on her own journey of recovery and healing, with humor playing a role in that process. @therealshannypants @shannypantsshowpodcast 

In S5:E7 - Church Cults, Trauma, and Humor  we discuss the dynamics of control and the impact that it has on us, we also discuss the role of humor in trauma recovery. It’s a really great conversation, with plenty of serious moments and also plenty of laughs!

2/3
Je fais d’ailleurs une grande différence entre une personne souvent mineure sous emprise émotionnelle d’un adulte manipulateur et une jeunesse de 20 ans, alerte et complice d’une relation intéressée.
Ces spécimen ne sont pas rares. 
Aussi, vous n’avez d’autres choix que de faire semblant d’ignorer avec prudence, pour travailler. Plus tard, je rencontrais un autre homme en soirée. Il se présenta producteur de télévision, comme un sesame qui lui donnerait un accès prioritaire à mon intimité. Il essuya malgré tout un refus. Or, lorsque je participais à une émission dont je découvris sur place qu’il en était producteur, ma participation fut écourtée. Une certaine lucidité voulait croire à une forme d’honnêteté et que cette éviction était liée à mes compétences. Aussi je continuais à bosser pour m’améliorer. Mais l’expérience me démontra que cette abnégation n’était pas dépourvue d’un brin de naïveté. 
« Est-ce que tout ça est sérieux ? » dit le poète. Est-ce que tout ça est sain?
Aussi, quand je revis le producteur de spectacle quelques années plus tard, il se comporta plus élégamment. 
Je décidais alors non pas de lui pardonner, mais de m’en tenir à une attitude professionnelle et respectueuse. Tout ce qu’il ne m’avait pas donné. La gêne, pour ne pas dire la honte devait changer de camps.
Pour ainsi dire, il me faisait plus de peine que de mal. 
Aussi le témoignage d’ @aurelien_wiik dans @leparisien est un cri qu’il faut entendre. Il est si puissant qu’il a réveillé mes souvenirs.
#metoogarçon #metoo #metoomovement #acteurs #chanteurs #danseurs #jeunesacteurs #jeuneschanteurs #jeunesdanseurs #cinema #musique #danse #spectacle #medias #comediesmusicales #cinemafrançais #casting #directeurdecasting #producteur #parler #oserparler #jetecrois #justice

Tarana Burke, @taranajaneen, founder of the #MeTooMovement, is an African American civil rights activist known for her work in advocating for survivors of sexual violence, particularly within marginalized communities, including women of color, LGBTQ+ individuals, and low-income individuals.

Burke first coined the phrase "Me Too" in 2006 as a way to empower and support survivors of sexual assault, particularly young women of color. Her intention was to create a sense of solidarity and understanding among survivors.

She is the author of Unbound: My Story of Liberation and the Birth of the Me Too Movement, and You Are Your Best Thing: Vulnerability, Shame Resilience, and the Black Experience. Her letter to her great grandmother is included in the book, Black Love Letters, a collection of essays on community, joy, resilience and more.

DESCRIPTION:
My story - Part 1 🙏💗💪

If I'm honest I don't know where to begin, I've been in the the dark for a while facing and healing my past .

I was sexually abused as a child and came from an abusive family.
I was neglected , abandoned and I have pretty much been on my own my whole life.
I left home at 16 and left the UK at 17 .

I ran away from my past and have hidden this from the world and even myself. 
I had not gone through the pain, grief and anger to heal.

Therefore keeping everything inside I created a false self a people pleaser.

A people pleaser to keep the peace, to be loved and liked. To pretend everything was ok to people so that I would be accepted.

When I did have the courage to tell people my story it was too much I was a "Victim" and even told I was too dramatic , sensitive or that I thought the world was against me.

I understand that it's not easy for people to hear these things and it makes them uncomfortable , this is not really something we talk about in our society!!
They don't do it with a bad intention, they are not therapists and also when they are avoident how can they have empathy and feel for you if they don't themselves. 
I also get this as I did it my self too I've always been sensitive and have felt the sadness but I never really acknowledged what really happened I did my best not to get in a hole.

Not acknowledgeing the pain,  anger and grief I had inside I just continued surviving creating coping mechanisms to keep going and of course at one point it all came too much for me so I had to go deep inside.

Once I stopped having an eating disorder, stopped drinking and smoking and getting rid of all my distractions I started to heal.

Yoga has been a big anchor for for me.
A tool to ground and accept the process and to connect spiritually.

But it wasn't until COVID and that my daughter came in my life that I was ready to face the sexual abuse.

🎶 Scheduled to hit your playlist on all digital platforms

-
今天要來介紹的是妨害性自主中的猥褻罪

妨害性自主罪主要可以分為「性交」與「猥褻」
差別在於任意一方之性器是否接合
（包含口交、指交、肛交）

本篇為說明猥褻罪的部分
根據不同違犯對方意願的型式共分為—
強制猥褻、乘機猥褻、權勢猥褻、及準強制猥褻

上一篇鬼故事《藏在水面下的體育老師》
就是屬於權勢猥褻、及準強制猥褻哦

若要對加害者提吿，請務必針對相對應的罪刑提出告訴
假設加害者實際上是「乘機猥褻」
但告訴人為了讓對方被法律重重制裁
而要求檢察官對當事人提起「強制猥褻」的告訴
很可能最後會因為引述錯誤的法源而獲不起訴的結果
那不代表加害者沒有錯、不代表台灣法律只保護壞人

而是法律只保護懂法律的人。

DESCRIPTION:
Are you looking to boost your cause on social media? Share your passion by telling your story! How about the story that inspired your passion? From the days of sitting around a crackling fire and telling your family and friends stories that turned into legends, time has proven that the best way to connect with people is through telling them a story.

In this short-attention-span era it's important to capture your audience's attention immediately or they will move on. I know I do! The best way to do this is with visuals to capture attention - videos/reels are an excellent method to use. Try keeping it fresh with a variety of different types of posts to keep people interested and provide them with something they want to keep coming back to see. 

And did you know this year is all about being REAL? Be real, talk to your audience, interact with your supporters, ask questions, and build a community! When people feel involved and you share your raw passion, it is much easier to ignite a fire. 🔥

Need help coming up with a strategy? Need someone to create some posts for you? Need a logo for your cause? Just slide into my DMs and let's connect!

Like, share, and comment if you found this helpful! ✌
.
.

A decade ago when I began working with traumatised children, I was taught the concept of the window of tolerance, which aided me in understanding how we can unexpectedly be pushed out of our emotional comfort zone as trauma survivors, and how it manifests within our bodies. Because I have PTSD also, I feel my regulated window resembles more of a delicate thin green line, 🫠 with hyperarousal and hypoarousal being where I tend to jump back and forth from when triggered. The objective of grounding techniques is to guide us out of these states and back into a place of safety within our bodies, and back into the green 💚🤗x #PTSD #CPTSD #triggered #flashback #depression #ptsdrecovery #ptsdawareness #ptsdsurvivor #sexualassault #grounding #truecrime #ukcrime #dissociation #truth #dissociativedisorder #childhoodtraumasurvivor #childsexualabuse #warrior #sexualabusesurvivor #windowoftolerance #childhoodtraumasurvivor #childhoodsexualabusesurvivor #trauma #warrior #sexualabuse #sexualabusesurvivor #healing #quotes #healing #addiction #mentalheath #psychology #mentoo #metoo

Found out today that the podcast I was interviewed for last year is finally being released! The first episode of "The Secret History of Antarctica: Death on the Ice," entitled "Arrival," can be found on @apple podcasts and @spotify today. 

I share my story of sexual assault in McMurdo Station in the fourth episode, "Madhouse at the End of the Earth." You can either listen to it for free when it is released on Monday, March 18th, or you can tune in to all of the episodes when you subscribe to Crowd Stories on Apple Podcasts. 

Many thanks to @crowdnetwork @annaestaufenberg (and @theeditorspeaks on X) for giving me the opportunity to spread awareness for survivors. 

#metoo #metoomovement #metooantarctica #metoomcmurdo #metoosouthpole #metoopalmer #survivor #sexualassault #sexualabuse #sexualharassment #sahprreport #accountability #advocate #podcast 

Posted @withregram • @crowdnetwork The Secret History is back with The Secret History of Antarctica!

Following the success of the #1 true crime series The Secret History of Flight 149 (2023 ARIA Nominated for Best Factual Series) and The Secret History of the Estonia, journalist stephen davis is investigating an unexplained death that occurred in one of the most isolated and deadly locations in the world.

In the year 2000 a young Australian astrophysicist named Rodney Marks died in strange circumstances while conducting scientific research on Antarctica. Despite numerous inquests over the years, his tragic death remains unsolved to this day.

As the series unfolds, we learn startling details about the reality of life on the ice; a demanding, isolated existence which, as we discover, can drive people to do bad things. Stephen interrogates who was responsible for the failed investigation, and what – if anything – has changed in the years since the tragedy.

The Secret History of Antarctica: Death on the Ice is out now, wherever you get your podcasts.

Sou treinador de boxe desde o ano de 1997. 
Em todos esses anos trabalhando em alto rendimento tanto nos clubes por onde passei quanto na seleção brasileira de boxe e, posteriormente, nas equipes de MMA, eu nunca vi um peso pesado que reunisse tantas capacidades físicas e habilidades motoras tendo a o biotipo e a compleição física como tem o nosso Renan Ferreira @renan_problema_mma .
Ou o cara era grande mas não tinha força, ou tinha força mas não tinha coordenação motora, ou tinha habilidades e capacidades mas era pequeno, ou seja… nunca era o “pacote completo” como o Renan é! 
Desde que ele chegou aqui na American Top Team o trabalho que temos feito em conjunto com ele e toda nossa equipe de treinadores tem contribuído sobremaneira para a conquista de altos resultados esportivos. 
Fico extremamente feliz por fazer parte importante desse processo de evolução dele e poder ver de perto as suas conquistas.
Eu procurei minha vida toda por esse cara! 
O mais doido nisso tudo é que foi ele quem me encontrou!

DESCRIPTION:
I haven’t been able to sleep since I got to Houston, my new job & certain dynamics about this have my PTSD flaring up. 

I’ve been going hard on sleeping meds but they’re not helping much. I keep crying, I’m happy & so grateful & blessed to be here & to be  starting this new job soon, but flashbacks & nightmares & just being plain scared of a monster & his unpredictable rage & past history of extreme violence due to coming to Houston during my divorce are hitting me harder than I thought. 

My ex gets really really mad when I used to go to Houston & he takes it out on my kids. He “broke the baby’s face” when I went camping in Houston. I thought he was gunna kill me, kill the kids just I when he used to punish me for camping in Houston. 

I haven’t announced yet where I’ll be working, but he knows for who & where. That scares me & it’s ok to feel things & trust myself. I’m here to get my kids back & start facing my fears. 

Self care is where I’ll be focusing. More reading. Better eating & I’m gunna try to start 5am runs again to help with this PTSD. My trauma therapist said he’s only seen my level of PTSD in 3% of his patients. That’s ok. Gunna stay sweet & happy & hardworking anyways. 

There is a war at home & my children & I are trapped in these trenches. 

There is a war at home. If only someone knew? 

❤️🤍💙 🤫❤️‍🩹💔

Post separation abuse is a dangerous place. Some of us do not make it out alive. A divorce is only the beginning. After you leave the abuser comes for your children. Family court tortures you & throws you & your children into an invisible cage. 

💜💔🇺🇸❤️🤍💙

Narcissists demonstrate a profound lack of empathy, unable to genuinely understand or validate the emotions and experiences of others. 

They view individuals as mere instruments for their gratification, treating them as objects to be used and discarded at will. 

This callous disregard for the feelings and needs of others is a fundamental aspect of their personality, deeply ingrained and resistant to change. 

It is so important for you to recognise that the narcissist's behaviour is not your fault; it stems from the narcissist's inherent traits and dysfunctional coping mechanisms.

In honor of #TeenDatingViolenceAwarenessMonth we’re answering real questions from real teens who have attended PAVE/Survivors.org presentations.

Today’s question 💭
What should if I don’t feel comfortable sharing sexual experiences with friends that want to know everything?

You’re never obligated to discuss your sexual activity with anyone. It can be difficult when friends of ours want to know our sexual history and we are uncomfortable sharing that information with them. Remember that consent isn’t just for sexual activity, we should practice and respect consent in any and all contexts, including when having personal conversations with friends.
