My aunt lived in that area, and we were taken there daily. I can remember her telling me I was special and that I would be a star someday. That I had to do everything she said. Listen, practice.
My father was supposed to be watching my sister and me, but he would take us there and leave us with her. For part of that time we stayed with my aunt until we could get our own place. My father was supposed to be looking for work, but he would take off with my blood uncles every day, so it got to be that I never saw either parent for long periods of time. That would change on occasion when my father would take me with him to bars while he drank or played in a band or both. I would be at the bar with one of his girlfriends. It seemed perfectly natural to me.
My aunt began to sexually abuse me the first night. It continued the entire time we were there. Months. I didn't know until years later that my sister was locked in a closet while this went on.
Eventually we got a place of our own and the abuse stopped.
A few months later my cousins came to live with us and the sexual abuse started again. Just different people. It ended a few months later when they were caught. They had us tied up. The cords were tight. Not really cords at all, cloths line. My sister and I were tied back to back. My cousins, a sister and brother had already molested us for over an hour. I cannot recall where my mother was during that period of my life. She was gone a lot. I think she was working because he didn't work. That's all I know.

En 2016 hubo un caso muy famoso donde una joven fue v1ol4d4 durante las fiestas de San Fermín por un grupo de 5 hombres que se hacían llamar a sí mismos “La Manada”  La víctima los denunció y el único delito que procedió, fue que uno de esos hombres le robó su celular para grabar todo el acto. No fue hasta que muchos países comenzaron a manifestarse que los jueces decidieron volver a revisar la evidencia y decidir que serían condenados a 15 años de cárcel. 

Igualmente se narran otros casos como el “caso Pozoblanco” donde 4 de los mismos hombres estuvieron involucrados, el “caso Nagore” y así hasta llegar al primer #MeToo español. 

Esta película documental fue producida en secreto durante casi 4 años y expone, gradualmente, las costuras del machismo en la justicia, los medios y la sociedad, arrojando luz sobre la violencia sexual que viven a diario muchas mujeres y la responsabilidad individual y colectiva hacia este problema universal.

Sexual violence is never ok. This includes during wartime.

The UN has stated that they have “credible” reports of sexual violence being committed against Palestinian women and girls by the IDF. Women have reported being stripped and humiliated, subjected to image based abuse, sexual assault, and rape, as well as being threatened with these violations. There is no way to frame this as self defence. 

Just as the UN’s Special Representative on Sexual Violence in Conflict called for an investigation into sexual violence on the 7th of October, the UN is now calling for investigations into these crimes. Sexual violence against anyone is not ok, and sexual violence against one group does NOT justify sexual violence against another group. 

If as a survivor you are struggling because of hearing such news, please remember there is help available, including many support services pinned on our page 💖

.

Survivors, we see you, we hear you, we believe you, and we stand by you. 

📌 See our pinned post for national and state based services. If you or someone you know is at immediate risk, contact emergency services on 000.

Directors in their 30s should never seduce a female actor (or any actor of any gender), under the age of 20. Really it shouldn’t happen. 

To the young actors out there, protect yourself. Even if you feel attraction to an adult director above the age of 30… ask yourself why you are and if it seems appropriate or inappropriate for them to be secretly dating you. Ask yourself why it’s a secret, and who it benefits. 
I would say to the directors… please do not date anyone who works for you under the age of 20. If you are an adult director, leave the actors under the age of 20 alone. Just don’t do it.Ask yourself why you are interested in a young actor playing a teen character, even if they are 18 or 19, technically adult, but ask yourself why you are pursuing them? Then ask yourself why you feel the need to keep it secret. Power is power. You know you have power in this circumstance, as an older adult, and as a director. Stay away from the young ones. Don’t do it. 
✊🏼

DESCRIPTION:
Helpful reminder for a Monday. 

You are not your work. 

You are not the you who is late for work, early for work, enjoys your work, or can't wait for work to end. 

You are not what you do, or how you feel. 

What makes up you is a complex beautiful tapestry of experiences, dreams, potential, loves, beliefs, past lives, future lives, friendships, acquaintances, the interaction with the stranger on the train. 

Big milestones, small fancies. 

But the main message here - you are not your work. 

And therefore, do not fear a Monday morning. 

It is just another day, another opportunity to get to know yourself a little bit deeper. 

And, breathe....

DESCRIPTION:
Many victim-survivors find themselves accused of “causing drama” when they seek support from friends and family. Shaming survivors like this causes so much harm; it not only harms the survivor but perpetrates rape culture. 

Speaking out and trying to get support from people you trust enough to tell is NOT “causing drama”.

Believe survivors. Support survivors. 

💖

Survivors, we see you, we hear you, we believe you, and we stand by you. 

📌 See our pinned post for national and state based services. If you or someone you know is at immediate risk, contact emergency services on 000.

💖💬 Like/comment/share/save to help this post reach more survivors in need of support 🌟 Follow to join our community of survivors 💖

Not getting our posts on your feed? Add us to your Favourites feed ✅

Generous donations from our community have enabled us to renovate another room at our shelter. We very much appreciate your support.

Support of these efforts is both an investment in the only certified emergency shelter for survivors of domestic and sexual abuse in St. Johns County and their minor children and a commitment to help those transition from domestic violence victims to survivors.

Our rooms need renovations and makeovers, and we've asked for makeovers to include paint, bedding, décor, and bathroom supplies. Last year, 325 adults and children spent 28,652 bed nights in our shelter.

Donations to this project will help with the bedroom makeovers and the needed flooring, repairs, hardware, and appliances to create a safe and welcoming environment throughout our shelter. 

With the growth we've seen in St. Johns County, more families need our help than ever before - and the complexity of those needs has also increased. 

If you'd like to help, please call our office at (904) 808-8544 or donate any amount online at the link in our profile, and write room makeover in the comments. 

If you're being abused or have been abused, please call the Betty Griffin Center 24-hour crisis hotline at (904) 824-1555, or TTY users dial (904) 827-0236. Text us at https://bettygriffincenter.org/ by clicking on the blue icon.

DESCRIPTION:
🚨NEW EPISODE🚨

Chloe Wade on Writing for Theatre and her new play As SHE Likes It

Chloe is an actor, writer and theatre maker who trained at the International School of Acting and Central School of Speech and Drama. 

With over 10 years of working in film, TV and theatre she is best known for playing Joanne Grantham in BBC’s Doctors and the lead role in independent film Honeycomb Lodge that won the Best Film at the Delhi International Film Festival. Over lockdown she starred alongside Helen Mirren in The Secret Life of Ophelia. 

She is also the alumna of the Actor-Writer course and is a supported writer of the Sheffield Theatre’s Bank Cohort. Chloe is currently reigning champion of the Birmingham Rep’s Monologue Slam competition with her piece “May I Take Your Order Please”, based on her time working in hospitality. 

In this episode we discuss Chloe’s brand new play that’s currently on tour across the UK, As SHE Likes It, a play bringing to light the sexual harassment that has/is going on in Hollywood and how it dates back back to the 1920s, not just to Harvey Weinstein. 

The play is based on the story of actress Patricia Douglas who was abused at an MGM party in 1937. Despite her efforts to bring her perpetrators to justice the case was thrown out and nothing came of it. I had the privilege to see and review the show with @uppercircle_theatre (review group that Chloe and I are part of) you can find it on my profile. It’s a fantastic piece packed with harsh truths that everyone needs to hear and see to stop this harassment from continuing. 

Check out Chloe’s website and Instagram for more information on her, the tour and how to get in touch. 

Website: chloe-wade.com
Instagram: @chloewadprod @yorkshirewade

Let’s chat about @estherperelofficial turning conflict into connection course.
Conflict doesn’t have to be “scary”. In fact, if two people are both doing their individual work and aligned then it’s simply an opening for a vulnerable conversation. 

My number one take away from the course:
if you bring up a difficult conversation and another shuts it down, it’s their job to return to the conversation.  If they don’t, rinse and repeat a few times before letting them go so you don’t continue having one sided conversations without resolution.  If you shut it down, let them know when you’ll return to work on resolution. When people show you who they are, believe them.  Actions over words though words are telling. 🙌🏻😉🙏🏼

You are worthy of a partner who desires communication, resolution, and deep connection. And steak dinners at home on Friday night.  And flowers occasionally on a consistent date. Know your worth while intentionally dating and pick up a few friends along the way.  Don’t settle! What you seek is seeking you💐 🥩 💚

Green Flags in a Relationship: ✅✅✅
1️⃣ You and your partner have equal say in significant decisions within the relationship.
2️⃣ You believe what your partner has to say and don't feel the need to "prove" each other's trustworthiness.
3️⃣ You talk openly about physical, sexual, and reproductive choices together,
4️⃣ You give each other the freedom to be yourself and be loved for who you are.

Ce livre nous plonge vers la fin des années 80 et celle des 90. Il nous livre en reflet une époque a travers l’histoire de deux jeunes femmes, Rose et Solange qui se construisent, faisant l’expérience de leur féminité dans une époque où les violences sexuelles sont banales et où « il fallait être libérée mais pas trop pour ne pas être une salope ». 

Elles sont « meilleures amies » habitent en face l’une de l’autre dans un village du Pays basque. Le récit de ce cheminement est construit en deux versions : « D’après Rose », puis « D’après Solange » , suivi d’une sorte de conclusion : « Ensemble ».

L’histoire commence dès leur 15 ans au lycée et se poursuit avec leur entrée dans la vie active. Les  deux jeunes femmes n’évoluent pas dans le même milieu social. Rose rencontre Christian, fait des études psychologie et reste fidèle à son premier amour dans une vie aux apparences, toute tracée. Solange elle, tombe enceinte à 15 ans, sans pouvoir avorter car il est trop tard, et est « sauvée » pour ainsi dire, par le théâtre.

Des vies jalonnées de questionnements, de quête de soi, dans ces années où l’ambiance est reproduite -je dirai- à la perfection : les Rita Mistsouko, David Bowie, la loi Devaquet, le sida. On retrouve tout ! Même « le Chat bleu » à Bordeaux. 🐈‍⬛😉

Mon avis : 🤓🗯️

J’écoutais Marie Darrieussecq lors d’une émission sur Radio France qui disait « On est faite d’un corps et d’une tête déjà et pendant des millénaires quand même on nous a refusé la tête. Il a bien fallu qu’on la couse (…)»

Tout est dit ! Pour moi ce livre est une claque, il agit comme une révélation « Nous les filles on n’avait pas d’outil conceptuel pour penser ce qui nous arrivait ». 

À toutes ces femmes qui se croyaient libres dans un monde profondément patriarcal. C’est sûr, il y aura un avant et un après #metoo 

Ce livre nous parle d’une amitié qui m’interroge car elle reflète plus l’absence et l’abandon que la complicité et la solidarité. Ce qui révèle tout de même une profonde solitude…

👉L’information judiciaire visant Patrick Poivre d'Arvor pour viols a été élargie à deux viols et une agression sexuelle dénoncés par trois femmes différentes, tandis que les plaintes ou témoignages de 19 autres femmes ont été classés, a indiqué le parquet de Nanterre.

👉"Trois autres faits dénoncés ont fait le 27 février 2024 l'objet d'une saisine complémentaire des deux juges d'instruction déjà saisis des faits concernant madame Florence Porcel, afin que le périmètre de leurs investigations soit étendu à ces faits", deux viols et une agression sexuelle présumés commis entre 2007 et 2018, a encore précisé le ministère public, confirmant une source proche du dossier.

👉 Déjà accusé de viols et agressions sexuelles par au moins une quarantaine de femmes, PPDA fait aujourd’hui l’objet d’une information judiciaire ouverte après la plainte de l'autrice Florence Porcel.

👉 Plusieurs femmes accusant PPDA ont salué la décision des juges, bien que l'ancien présentateur conteste fermement les faits allégués.

👉 Cette première mise en examen est perçue comme une victoire dans le combat contre les agressions sexuelles, selon l'association @MeTooMédia fondée par trois victimes présumées du présentateur.

#PPDA #AgressionsSexuelles #Viol #Violence #MeToo #MeTooMedia #MeTooMovement #StopViolenceAgainstWomen @iamflorenceporcel @prive_murielr @metoomedia_

ENG
This XXIst century is offering us all many societal shifts
Funny I am writing this post in February, the month of carnival which societal objective is that of roles reversal within a human group.
#metoo began with women and cascaded through many different professions.
Let's be clear, it is not a question of profession, but a societal structural one.

Any abused child who could not be witnessed and trusted in their pain remains stuck with loneliness, hurt, fear, shame …within the adult who is carrying them
The gender of the child does not matter, the pain is similar.
What changes is the perception of 
what is a woman: kind, gentle, patient, smiling, sweet, weak, emotional, a mother or a whore 
and what is a man: strong, powerful, a leader, does not show emotions, solid, a knight, a warrior
well, no.
all of those traits can belong to a man or a woman
Working with an adult is working with kids and teens

Thank you @aurelien_wiik to state the reality
~~~~~~~
FR
Ce XXIème siècle nous offre de nombreux bouleversements sociétaux
Il est amusant que j'écrive ce billet en février, le mois du carnaval dont l'objectif sociétal est celui de l'inversion des rôles au sein d'un groupe humain.
#metoo a commencé par les femmes et s'est propagé en cascade dans de nombreuses professions.
Soyons clair.es, il ne s'agit pas d'une question de profession, mais d'une question structurelle de société.

Tout.e enfant maltraité.e qui n'a pas pu être reconnu.e et soutenu.e dans sa douleur reste bloqué.e dans la solitude, la blessure, la peur, la honte... à l'intérieur de l'adulte qui la/le porte
Le genre de l'enfant n'a aucune importance, la douleur est la même.
Ce qui change, c'est la perception sociétale de ce qu'est une femme : gentille, douce, patiente, souriante, faible, émotive, mère ou putain 
et ce qu'est un homme : fort, puissant, leader, ne montrant pas ses émotions, solide, chevalier, guerrier.
Eh bien, non.
tous ces traits peuvent appartenir à un homme ou à une femme
Un.e thérapeute qui travaille avec un.e adulte travaille avec des enfants et ados
Merci @aurelien_wiik de dire la réalité

As Australia reels in the wake of another domestic violence related homicide, we really need to address how we talk about these issues. 

We immediately had the press sensationalising the murder, reframing and focusing on it as the outcome of a “love triangle”, a scandal to be gossiped about rather than taken seriously. 

We then had the Police Commissioner calling it a “crime of passion”. Murders perceived as crimes of passion get taken less seriously by courts, as well as the media (as we have already seen). It also overlooks the power dynamics involved with the alleged murder being a police officer who used a police-issued firearm as the murder weapon. Australia has long had a very serious problem with police officers failing to take action against other police officers accused of domestic violence. 

There is then also the issue of domestic violence being taken less seriously in the context of LGBT relationships. LGBT victim-survivors face far more barriers to support and justice.

We can’t keep excusing, enabling, and protecting abusers. 

Luke Davies and Jesse Baird should still be alive, enjoying their lives together, enjoying the love they had for each other, enjoying the Sydney Mardi Gras with the LGBTQ community. 

💖

3/3
J’avoue n’avoir pas eu à tant souffrir. Sans doute dû à une certaine capacité à me relever de toutes épreuves. Mais je ne peux nier que d’autres que je connais, n’ont pas pu accéder aussi facilement à cette résilience. Ils ont mon soutien indéfectible. Le rêve et l’ambition ne peuvent autoriser ces abus. Et même si d’autres s’en servirent à leur benefice, les victimes doivent pouvoir exposer leur plaies sans que cela ne jette sur eux un voile de suspicion.
Hier soir, c’était la grande fête du cinéma. @judithgodreche1 a trouvé les mots en secouant les mauvaises habitudes, les laisser-allers et les frilosités complaisantes puis nous a rappelé à juste titre que l’avenir de notre métier dépendait de nous.
Si des femmes ont ouvert la voix (voie) pour dénoncer les agressions sexuelles qu’elles ont subies (Elles ont eu le courage de lancer l’alerte et de porter avec force cette révolution nécessaire comme souvent dans l’histoire des avancées sociales), elle n’en oublie pas les hommes qui ont dû également y faire face. 
Ils sont plus nombreux qu’on ne le dit.
Ce combat ne devant pas être un énième prétexte pour opposer les femmes aux hommes, il doit nous unir contre ces monstres épris de pouvoir qu’on tolère depuis trop longtemps.

Les temps changent. 
Follement. Douloureusement. 
Mais ils le doivent. 
C’est une urgence prioritaire.

A few days ago, Education Ministers agreed to the Action Plan Addressing Gender-based Violence in Higher Education, which so many people have been advocating for for years. 

Thank you and congratulations to The Stop Campaign (@thestopcampaignaus), End Rape On Campus Australia (@erocaustralia), Our Watch (@ourwatch), Fair Agenda (@fair_agenda) and many more who made this possible; eg. victim-survivors, students and academics, advocates, support services, and policy makers who campaigned for these changes, journalists who brought more attention to it, donors who backed the organisations behind it, etc

Go to www.saferunis.org to learn more & use #IDeserveSafety to push this issue to the top of the national agenda!

Ich bin weiß, blond, habe helle Augen, bin in Deutschland geboren und aufgewachsen und alle meine Vorfahren, von denen ich weiß, sind es auch. Auf den ersten Blick bin ich also genau die Art von Mensch, die die AFD hier in Deutschland gerne hätte. 

Aber dieses Deutschland, das die Rechten dort malen, widert mich an. 

Die menschenverachtenden Pläne, die CORRECTIV aufgedeckt hat, hinterlassen uns in Schockstarre. Es ist erschreckend, wie von Hass und Hetze getriebene Gruppen von Menschen darüber entscheiden wollen, wer dieses Land Heimat nennen darf und wer in ihren Augen minderwertig ist. 

Neben dem klaren Signal, die eigene Stimme zu erheben, zeigen die Recherchen von CORRECTIV vor allem eines deutlicher als je zuvor: Die AFD ist keine Partei, die sich “für die kleinen Bürger“ einsetzt oder eine gehbare Alternative zu den Altparteien darstellt. Nein, die AFD steht für ein rassistisches, extremistisches und menschenverachtendes Programm, und wer sie wählt, ob aus Protest oder aus Überzeugung, und stillschweigend hinnimmt, welche Ideologie damit Gehör findet, der gibt damit Menschen Macht, die weder Entscheidungen treffen sollten noch zurechenbar sind.

Wir alle sind betroffen. Egal welche Hautfarbe, welchen Geburtsort, welche Muttersprache, welchen Nachnamen, welchen sozialen Hintergrund wir haben. Unser Wert als Menschen hängt von keinem dieser Faktoren ab. Niemand ist besser oder schlechter, nur weil der Pass bestimmten Kriterien entspricht. Und wer versucht, die Gesellschaft nach solchen Kriterien zu spalten, darf keine Bühne bekommen. 

Ich bin weiß, blond und habe helle Augen. Und ich verachte das, was gerade passiert. Keinen Zentimeter nach rechts. Keine Bühne für Rassisten.

People endure victim shaming, disbelief, and blame. . 2 men posted on a tread that Suzie Lamplu and Shirley Banks would be a alive today if I had spoke up. Laying the blame for their murders on me not the murderer! But a deeply traumatised child threatened with a return visit if I told anyone. The police and justice system does no better it often treats us as inconveniences, failing to provide adequate support when we speak up. This enables known abusers to perpetuate harm against any child they encounter. Victims are forced to prove their victimhood, bear the financial burden of therapy and treatment, and suffer from stigma and misinformation, leading to distrust of men who disclose childhood sexual abuse when around children. We are the victims not the perpetrators! Stop making out we need to prove we’re innocent in our own crimes and abuse firstly before affording us an investigation. You don’t do that to a burglary victims  #PTSD #CPTSD #triggered #flashback #depression #ptsdrecovery #ptsdawareness #ptsdsurvivor #sexualassault #uk #truecrime #ukcrime #dissociation #truth #dissociativedisorder #childhoodtraumasurvivor #childsexualabuse #warrior #sexualabusesurvivor #fyp #childhoodtraumasurvivor #childhoodsexualabusesurvivor #trauma #warrior #sexualabuse #sexualabusesurvivor #healing #quotes #healing #addiction #mentalheath #psychology #mentoo #metoo

Unas manos interpretan, en lengua de signos, las palabras “Se acabó”; decía Spivak que los sujetos subalternos no podían hablar no por su incapacidad física (de la que sí disponían) sino por su estatus en el margen, sin capacidad de enunciarse o nombrarse. Spivak hablaba de ese espacio en blanco entre las palabras que, si bien no tiene sonido, tiene entidad y existe, aunque permanezca en silencio. De la misma forma, estas manos interpretan un mensaje que es global, que se hizo viral en 2017 con un #MeToo y un #TimesUp pero que sigue vigente con un #SeAcabó que es también internacional. Un grito concentrado en unas manos precisas.

.

Some hands interpret, in sign language, the words "It's over"; Spivak said that subaltern subjects could not speak not because of their physical incapacity (which they did have) but because of their status on the margin, without the capacity to enunciate or name themselves. Spivak spoke of that blank space between words that, although it has no sound, has an entity and exists, even if it remains silent. In the same way, these hands interpret a message that is global, that went viral in 2017 with a #MeToo and a #TimesUp but that remains valid with a #SeAcabó that is also international. A cry concentrated in precise hands.

Texto de @semiramis_glez

Il y a quelques jours, l’acteur @aurelien_wiik révélait avoir été victime de violences sexuelles et lançait le #metoogarcons . Suite à ça, les témoignages n’ont fait qu’abonder.
La parole se libère de plus en plus. Et il est essentiel d’écouter et de soutenir. Car on le sait, pour dénoncer les violences sexistes et sexuelles, il faut du courage. Plus on écoutera, plus on s’opposera à ces actes, plus on s’affirmera et on pourra lutter contre.
Alors les garçons, on vous croit ❤️✊

[FORMATION] Intervention sur les Violences Sexistes et Sexuelles (VSS)

🌟 Un immense merci à l'équipe de @metoomedia_  pour avoir laissé une empreinte durable sur notre parcours académique ! 🙏

🤝Ces mardi et mercredi, nous avons eu la chance de rencontrer @emmadancourt, journaliste indépendante et chroniqueuse sur @RMC, présidente de l’association MeTooMédia, ainsi que Noémie Luciani, enseignante à l’ESRA. Toutes les deux membres actives de l’association créée en 2021 pour lutter contre les violences sexistes et sexuelles dans les médias et plus généralement dans les milieux de la culture, elles sont également plaignantes dans des affaires appartenant au monde médiatique. 

Elles sont intervenues face aux étudiants du @master.cno.dijon et @masterjourna_ub afin de nous sensibiliser et nous former sur les VSS. 

💡 Les récits partagés, les témoignages, et les conseils pratiques nous ont accompagnés dans notre progression. Nous sommes maintenant armés de connaissances plus précises au sujet des VSS, mais aussi d'une nouvelle perspective sur notre responsabilité en tant que communicants et journalistes. 🌈

👏 Encore merci pour cette expérience humaine pleine d’empathie et riche en apports pratiques. Il est important de partager ce message et de faire prendre conscience au plus grand nombre des enjeux sociétaux que représentent les violences sexistes et sexuelles. 

#VSS #MeToo #metoomovement #metoomedia #metoomedias #formation #sensibilisation #victimes #masterCNO

DIE POLYESTER-QUEEN
... erzählt faszinierende Einblicke in die Welt der Werbe- und Model Branche.

*international fesselnde Geschichten und Insiderperspektiven des Autors. 
*Drei Dekaden autobiografisch multikultureller Erlebnisse und (Reise -) Geschichten; seine Arbeit mit Berühmten, sowie wichtigen Models in teils schrillen Werbe Welten.
* inklusive 720 Bild-Kampagnen und Image Fotografieren
* 28 nicht erfundene Kurzgeschichten die sein Leben so schrieb.

 Das Buch ist für Dich, wenn Du Dir NICHT vorstellen kannst, wie es ist, wenn Du Donald Trump und seine männlichen Freunde hinter den internationalen Model-Kulissen erlebst.

 Zudem findest Du zeitgeistige Geschehnisse, hinsichtlich Rassismus, #metoo-Missbrauch und dem beginnenden Klimawandel.

Eindrücke die der Autor so ganz nebenbei mitbekam.

❤️❤️❤️ ~Rebecca

DESCRIPTION:
Authored By: Simran
The PoSH Act was put into effect to shield women from sexual harassment at work and to prevent it from happening, providing a safe atmosphere for them to work in. As a mandatory compliance with the PoSH Act, any organization with more than ten employees must set up an Internal Complaints Committee (ICC) in the prescribed manner to receive and handle women's complaints of sexual harassment in a highly confidential and time-bound manner. The POSH Act is not gender-neutral; only women can register complaints.
Read More: https://www.barelaw.in/prevention-of-women-from-sexual-harassment-in-the-workplace/
Visit our website at: www.barelaw.in

DESCRIPTION:
🌟 Healing Sexual Trauma 🌟

Today, I want to take a moment to shed light on a topic that’s incredibly important yet often silenced: healing from sexual trauma.

Sexual trauma can leave deep scars on our hearts and minds, impacting every aspect of our lives. 

But I want you to know that healing is possible. It’s a journey that takes time, courage, and support, but it is within reach.

If you’re struggling with the aftermath of sexual trauma, please know that you are not alone. 

There are resources and communities out there ready to offer guidance, understanding, and a safe space to heal.

Remember, your experiences do not define you. 

You are resilient, worthy of love, and deserving of peace. 

It’s okay to seek help and to take care of yourself along the way.

Let’s break the silence, support one another, and walk hand in hand on the path to healing.

DM me if you’d like some support 🙏💜
